content.title: Hepatic AVMs in HHT
content.description: Hepatic vascular malformations in hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia

key_concepts.details: Three shunting patterns: hepatic artery to hepatic vein, hepatic artery to portal vein, portal vein to hepatic vein
High-output cardiac failure, portal hypertension, biliary ischemia
Multiphase CT or MRI demonstrates enlarged hepatic artery, arteriovenous shunting
Medical management preferred; liver transplantation for severe cases; embolization generally contraindicated

content.clinical_significance: Hepatic AVMs may cause progressive heart failure requiring close monitoring
